{"step_by_step_thinking": "Bone necrosis, or death of bone tissue, can occur due to a variety of reasons, including temperature. When drilling an implant, the friction can cause the temperature to rise. Studies have shown that bone tissue can start to die at temperatures above 47 degrees Celsius. Therefore, the temperature at which bone necrosis occurs while drilling an implant would be higher than this.", "answer_choice": "A"}
